revised_title: Mantis Shrimp Eye Structure and Polarized Light Detection
tldr: Mantis shrimps possess compound eyes with unique structures that enable them to detect and analyze polarized light. Their eyes have three distinct regions, with various adaptations that allow different portions of the eye to perform different visual tasks. Mantis shrimps have the potential to analyze polarized light in a detailed manner, which may help them navigate and locate prey in their environment.
